351688758.name: Enjoyable afternoon
351688758.author: a TripAdvisor user
351688758.reviewBody: We stopped at Ciudad Valles as a layover for 9 hours.  We were not sure where to go.  We took a pesera (local bus) to the "centro".  There we found their market area which was full of things to see and do.  We had lunch at Don Lenchos Taqueria within the market.  So yummmmy!!! It has extremely limited seating but worth the wait and the cramped area.  We also saw some live dancers which was gorgeous to watch.  We then walked a couple of blocks to the plaza location which is indicated here.  There was music on the loud speaker, a mix of American and Mexican music.  We sat on the benches and enjoyed the scenery.  We then walked down to the riverside and enjoyed some quiet time there.  There is a lot to look at in terms of trinklets and fun food to enjoy.  We felt very safe.  Of course take precautions, as you would anywhere you travel.  Great time!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Pedro Antonio de los Santos

463758871.name: WONDERFUL PLACE!!
463758871.author: a TripAdvisor user
463758871.reviewBody: We are going back! People, food and sites were amazing! love it! Also getting to know the surroundings! loving atmosphere! I wish I had a place like that to go every weekend!

376249586.name: Still fail to see the attraction
376249586.author: a TripAdvisor user
376249586.reviewBody: I\'ve been to these caves for decades. Each time I promise myself I will learn their secrets. There are some interesting stories by the locals about magic in the caves, but I never felt it. \n\nYou can only visit them if you are staying at the hotel.

277718789.name: Very near Ciudad Valles, San Luis Potos\u00ed
277718789.author: a TripAdvisor user
277718789.reviewBody: It is a beautiful place, with sulphur and warm water, and a big Cave,,also is behind the mountains,,,I like it very much...\n

251779759.name: Good
251779759.author: a TripAdvisor user
251779759.reviewBody: Not expensive or a 5 star hotel, but it\'s inviting for a relax weekend,  they have activities like a temazcal and many pools, probably a night there would be enough. Rooms are big.

226772392.name: Fantastic Place
226772392.author: a TripAdvisor user
226772392.reviewBody: Hotel Taninul is an extraordinary place with a natural pool, zip line, and a cave made for nightlife.  They have a wide range of outdoor activities at the hotel and its surrounding areas.  This place is a must!

169548380.name: Relaxing
169548380.author: a TripAdvisor user
169548380.reviewBody: If you are looking for a calm,relaxing and quiet day, this is it! If you are visiting the Huasteca Potosina don\'t miss this hotel, it is unique!

120631337.name: So cool!
120631337.author: a TripAdvisor user
120631337.reviewBody: Beautiful water, comfortable temperature, a rare and once in a lifetime experience.

46555242.name: Didn\u00b4t actually stay at the resort but did the Temazcal and it was amazing!
46555242.author: a TripAdvisor user
46555242.reviewBody:
Taninul isn´t actually in Ciudad Valles, it´s about a 30 minute drive away.  We were staying at Hotel Aventura Huasteca and the guide from our rappelling tour recommend that we go and enjoy the temazcal at the resort that night.  For those of you that don´t know what that is it´s kinda like a mud-like igloo where they have sauna rocks inside with herbs and flowers in with the rocks.   But before you go in you cover yourself in mud, have a little spiritual ceremony (I am not religious but practice yoga, I find it similar to yoga meditation) and then you wash off the mud in the natural thermal spring.  

It was a pretty amazing experience if you like this type of thing.  Many of my friends have done temazcales but I had always been pretty unsure of them.  When you are in the igloo you give thanks to what you have, you apologize to the people and things you have hurt, you wish for anything and you ask forgiveness for your regrets all the while they add more rocks and make the hut hotter.  

after the ceremony they dowse you in cool water and lay you down and wrap you up in warm blackets and finish off at the end with a special tea with a spoon of honey.

All for only 150 pesos per peson!!  Which is about 12usd each.  

I loved it and the grounds of the resort look really nice.. the natural pool does look a little scummy though but it´s natural so what can you do.  We might consider staying there next time we go back though as they have rock climbing there.  

Try to avoid weekends and national holidays to visit there.  We visited there during the Sept. 15th weekend and the place was packed.   The temazcal started at 7pm I think but arrive an hour early and they let you enjoy the pools.

676204584.name: Rafting
676204584.author: a TripAdvisor user
676204584.reviewBody: Very organized , professional, safe and what a fun crew \r\nWill recomend to all my friends back home!!!

675338548.name: Great time rafting with Huaxteca.com!
675338548.author: a TripAdvisor user
675338548.reviewBody: We went rafting with Huaxteca.com at the end of March on the Rio Tampaon. It was the perfect time of year. The water was up, but the tourists hadn\'t descended on the place yet. The guys picked us up in their van on time and even spoke enough English to get by. We got out on the water with minimal trouble and had a great guide to lead us down the river and through the rapids. Had a great time! It was challenging enough for us newbs but never really scary. Plenty of relaxing parts in between the rapids and chances to swim as well. Plenty of great photos opps and a great lunch to finish it off! Would definitely recommend!

The two leads us through the waterfalls, the streaming and we jumped several times from different heights - which we had to climb before. We had so much fun with them, we leaned some spanish and had a little party in the bus between the stops :-) But it wasn\'t only the swimming in waterfalls, we stopped also for typical Mexican food and for sugarcane juice - and the food in mexico...muy rico! 671245438.name: Waterfall Excursion
671245438.author: a TripAdvisor user
671245438.reviewBody:
This was the waterfall tour of Minas Viejas, Salto and Micos.  We stopped at a large cat sanctuary on our way to the first waterfall.  We passed a massive sugar cane plant where they gave a history. (Or so I believe.  I was the only English speaker on the tour so I just politely sat back and looked at the window.)  We had sufficient time to swim and take photos at each of the locations.  
**LEAVE YOUR BELONGINGS IN THE VAN***
I brought my hat, sunglasses and a bottle of water to the waterfall.  When I got out of the water they were gone.  My friend told me that is very common and never to leave anything unattended.  

Although I could not understand the tour guides the one named Luis spoke some English.  He took time out to talk to me one on one and tell me about the waterfalls. This was a great aspect of the tour and greatly appreciated!  

I would recommend this tour to anyone!

598198652.name: Most fun we had in Huasteca!
598198652.author: a TripAdvisor user
598198652.reviewBody:
We had the most fun here of any of the places we visited in Huasteca!

30 pesos to get in but then you need to get a guide and life jackets.  Sorry I don't know the cost, our guide took care of it for us.  

Like everything you seem to do in Huasteca you have to climb stairs.  No different here. from the lake at the bottom of the last falls you climb up a bunch of staircases to get to the road (not as bad as the cave of swallows :-)) .

From there you jump down like 7 waterfalls.  One big one - one other reviewer mentioned 8 meters.  Its the tallest thing any of us ever jumped off of.  Under a waterfall after one of the jumps.  It was pouring rain for part of the time too.  Good times!   

Water is on the warm side (we were there in July of 18)  Our water guide had our go pro so he took pictures of each of us jumping off.  I brought a water proof camera on a lanyard that I took photos of everyone. 

Its a must do!

597181846.name: Loved it
597181846.author: a TripAdvisor user
597181846.reviewBody: The waterfalls are amazing. Jump them all!  Can even climb up and do the 8 meter one again and again.

582043086.name: Cascada de Micos, San Luis Potosi
582043086.author: a TripAdvisor user
582043086.reviewBody: Located in the Huasteca Potosina-  absolutely beautiful and easy to get to.  No need to make long hikes I order to get a view.  This is a great place to visit even for those people with limited mobility.  Highly recommend taking a walk on the wild side with the guys at AdventureLand- eco friendly adventure !  If you are ready and able repelling at 80+ per hour above the waterfalls will not disappoint \u2764\ufe0f

574234085.name: Great experience
574234085.author: a TripAdvisor user
574234085.reviewBody: Beautiful set of waterfalls - like one infinity pool after another. We hired a guide and climbed to the top, jumping from one pool into the next. Many of the jumps were too high for my wife (some seemed 5 meters or so), but our guide found a gentler route for her. All in all it was a terrific experience that I would love to do again. Guide was well worth it to find the best places to jump and he took photos of us all the way down.

573690971.name: Fun
573690971.author: a TripAdvisor user
573690971.reviewBody: This place is one of the highlights of Huasteca Potosina. Be prepared to pay 180 pesos extra for tour/pictures/life best you will not be able to do the jumps otherwise. That being said I would look for Javier (tour company is the one in blue), he was an amazing guide and has been working there for 20 years. The site itself needs little advertisement, gorgeous landscape to do sequential jumping in different height cascades... truly fun and amazing

554101572.name: Cascada de Micos from Ciudad Valles via public transport
554101572.author: a TripAdvisor user
554101572.reviewBody:
Had a lovely couple of hours at the Micos waterfalls. We caught a Vencedor bus from Calle 5 de Mayo (half a block south of Jardin Hidalgo) in Ciudad Valles. Asked the lady for Micos and she charged us 21 pesos each. It dropped us at a 'look-out' a few kilometers past the town of Platanito. There is a zip lining company running from here if you're into that. We had been told there were stairs down to the falls so after a few misdirections, we continued walking the way the same bus was driving for about a kilometer until we came to a hydroelectric building with a set of concrete stairs leading down. At the bottom, there is a primitive path leading to the top pool and largest set of falls and is also the access point for a place you can jump into the second pool. Continuing through the chain link gate and down, there are some rocks you can watch from and another jump. Most people had a guide with them to jump, those who didn't also wore life jackets. We didn't swim (was too cold!) but it seemed you had to wear the life jacket regardless. 
Coming down the stairs, there was no one charging entry. However, when you walk back to the 'look-out', continue towards where the falls go under the road. On the non-river side there are a set of stairs going under the road and they take you all the way down to the toilets/snack bar/camping area which you pay 30 pesos for entry. 
We ended up walking back into Platanito and a colectivo taxi took us back to Centro Ciudad Valles for 25 pesos each but a local man said the Vencedor buses came back that way eventually. 
Please note we speak very very basic Spanish so all of this is relatively easy if you have the same or any more than we do!
The falls were lovely and very quiet when we were there. Recommended.

511164983.name: Great place for all ages
511164983.author: a TripAdvisor user
511164983.reviewBody: We went with children ranging in age from 6 to 14, plus us big children . It is compulsory to rent flotation vests. You need to keep an eye on the younger children near the falls because the current is strong although quickly diminishes. There are small pools for the very young or old to splash in as well as the falls and ledges for older children to jump from. There are guided tours available. There are camping places available and barbecue sites. There are gift shops and snacks available.

480371222.name: Very busy place
480371222.author: a TripAdvisor user
480371222.reviewBody: Nice cascades, water is clean. But unfortunately you have to wear life vests if you want to go for a swim.

440755380.name: Awesome waterfalls jumping experience
440755380.author: a TripAdvisor user
440755380.reviewBody: The place is amazing, jumping through seven waterfalls of different heights, the highest one of 9m. Amazing views while swimming and being between the mountains. A most place to visit.

416482798.name: Nice water fall
416482798.author: a TripAdvisor user
416482798.reviewBody: Due to the season the water wasnt as clear, still nice though. Try to visit when it not raining as water isnt as clear as it seems in the picture. Also sometimes there is no access due to the increase in water level.

385284760.name: Amazing and relaxing
385284760.author: a TripAdvisor user
385284760.reviewBody: This place is nice, you can\'t do much other than swim and jump some waterfalls, definitely take a tour guide with you to experience the whole thing from the beginning of the waterfalls, to the end of them. It\'s about 10 that you can jump and swim in..

376249101.name: Aguamarine waters, series of small waterfalls
376249101.author: a TripAdvisor user
376249101.reviewBody:
Just because I rated this attraction with 4 stars doesn't mean it's not appealing. There are several waterfalls in the area and compared to the others it is not the most spectacular. It is, however, the most accessible. Paved roads all the way. Families and small children can get close to parts of the falls. 

There are places where you can jump into the water, you could paddleboard and float on in inner tube if you wish. None of these require you to be fit or overly adventurous. It is an easy introduction to waterfalling. 

RV "boondocking" is allowed on the grounds, so both tent campers, truck campers and big RV's can all spend the night. There are dozens of food vendors and stalls selling ticky-tacky. 

It's a good place and an easy drive from Cd. Valles. You should go.

344856638.name: awsome waterfall jumping
344856638.author: a TripAdvisor user
344856638.reviewBody: it was so much fun, although scary at the beginning, to jump from the different waterfalls. you can even stand behind a waterfall in a cave:O soooo nice! and thanks to the life vests you dont even have to know how to swim...

336317155.name: Cascadas de Rio Micos
336317155.author: a TripAdvisor user
336317155.reviewBody:
The Cascadas (waterfalls) of Rio Micos are a wonderful attraction in the vicinity of Ciudad Valles, SLP, Mexico.     There are seven waterfalls, ranging from 6 feet (2 meters) up to 25 feet (8 meters) in height.  Between each waterfall there is a pool (poza), from 200 up to 400 feet in length, all are beautiful.   The setting is gorgeous, as the waterfalls sit on the bottom of a canyon, maybe 600/700 feet tall, full with vegetation.  

While this spectacle would be enough, the fun part of the activity is to be able to jump from pool to pool from the waterfall´s edge.     You need aqua-shoes or tennis shoes, as the rock is at times very slippery.   There are some strong currents, but nothing that can not be navigated by an ok swimmer.    If you want to take more precautions you can wear a helmet and/or a floating device.     If you travel with Huaxteca.com the guides are not only attentive, but very safety conscious.    The drawback is to have a large group of different ages/different athletic ability folks, that can drag the movement from waterfall to waterfall.

If you travel with your own group, Huaxteca.com offers "private tours", say for 6-12-20 people, with guides and equipment and this would make the jumping so much more enjoyable and fast paced.    It takes, depending on the group, from 45 minutes to 90 minutes to complete the circuit.

A great excursion would be to do the circuit twice, while having time to enjoy the scenery and the thrill from the higher jumps.    There are pools (pozas) where you can jump from other rocks into water depths over 15 feet, so there is no risk of hitting a rock at the bottom.

The water temperature in december was 26/27 degrees celsius, so a bit colder than a swimming pool, but nothing you can not get used to quickly, specially when the sun is out at 11 AM or later.

It is almost impossible to find the entry if you are by yourself the first time, but it is possible that after a "guided" excursion, you can return on your own (no restrictions or limitations, no lifeguards, no safety measures, you are at your own risk) and jump without equipment and have the time of your life.

Worth going for sure!!

328782890.name: Stunning spot and loads of fun
328782890.author: a TripAdvisor user
328782890.reviewBody: I can\'t recommend this place enough! It is so beautiful and there\'s plenty of fun to be had in the water. We caught a local Vencedor bus out from Ciudad Valles for less than 20 pesos and the driver dropped us right by the staircase that winds down to the cascadas. We went on a Saturday so it was busy but so much fun. You can rent life jackets if required, there\'s toilets, changing rooms, snack and beer stalls and local guys willing to paddle you right up to the cascadas in little boats if you prefer not to get wet. There\'s so much fun to be had in the water. The mesmerising green water is lovely to swim in and the current isn\'t too strong. You can climb up and stand under the smaller cascadas on the river side for an amazing natural shoulder massage. The main falls are great to jump off if you can clamber up either side. The riverside can get a bit muddy if it\'s busy and the changing rooms are a bit grim but otherwise this is a total winner and a must do if you\'re in the area. Getting back to Valles is super easy either via the bus or the regular 25 peso colectivo vans. Just flag either down on the roadside. Enjoy!

651910002.name: la huasteca potosina
651910002.author: a TripAdvisor user
651910002.reviewBody: It is really a very good option for one week vacation.  Culture, a lot of natural landscapes, a bunch of waterfalls.

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

606737264.name: Go for the boutique , personalized experience
606737264.author: a TripAdvisor user
606737264.reviewBody: The Huaxteca is pure magic. It is crowded during vacation time. MS expediciones was the first agency with 25 years of experience. We loved all the passionate guides and their personalized service. Our biggest group encompassed 8 people. This brings the experience to another level if you like to have more flexibility an see more of what you like. Safety was great and everyday we had lunch at a different authentic local house or restaurant, not at the tourist trap . All of the guides were great with kids. Make sure you bring a phone water proof bag or buy it there. Each of their plans has amazing scenery.

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

518574641.name: Bad service and unmotivated guide!
518574641.author: a TripAdvisor user
518574641.reviewBody:
We wanted to book three or four tours with MS Expidiciones, because they are recommended in our travel guide. We tried to book in advance but it was nearly impossible, because nobody answered my questions properly. I did get an answer though, but they never answered my questions but sent my some standard information sheets in spanish. 
We decided to book the tour directly at the office, but only one tour was available. So we booked one and they promised us that we can do another tour on the next day. 
The tour was ok,but the guide was quite unmotivated and didn't speak to us the whole drive to the activity, during the lunch and the drive back. 
As we asked the guide about the next tour, he told us that he can't guarentee that there is a tour at the next day and we should come to the office and maybe there is one.
As we don't want to waste our day we booked our tours with another company ( huasteca.com) and we had two great and amazing days with these guides. So if you want to come to Huasteca Potosina (which is totally worth it) you should book with this company, because they are professionals!

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

471109708.name: A Company to Trust with a Birthday Trip
471109708.author: a TripAdvisor user
471109708.reviewBody:
I was on a trip organized by Martha and MS Xpediciones in SLP in March. Activities ranged from Planet Earth experiences--seeing thousands of birds nosedive into the Cave of Swallows--to more extreme activities--rappelling next to a waterfall, jumping down waterfalls, etc. Somehow we almost always had the place--the waterfall, the river, the cave--to ourselves. 

The staff at MS Xpediciones were what really made the difference, though. They put a cake together for my birthday during the trip and went out of their way to take care of one of our members after he managed to burn himself at a restaurant. Martha came out to dinner with us towards the end of the trip just to check how well it had gone and to receive our thanks. 

The downside is that I'm now confronted with the inexorable dullness of my life back in the U.S.

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

468016280.name: Couldn\'t have been better!
468016280.author: a TripAdvisor user
468016280.reviewBody: From cascade jumping to whitewater rafting to waterfall repelling to cave swimming to mole consuming, these guys really set up and implemented a great trip. They helped with hotel accommodations as well, which all were great. I\'d highly recommend using them for your visit to SLP!

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

467611323.name: Xpediciones takes care of every need you didn\'t know you had
467611323.author: a TripAdvisor user
467611323.reviewBody: Xpediciones took us on a great trip through San Louis Potosi! We had a group of 10 people, and Xpediciones booked our hotel accommodation, took us to every location, and brought us to amazing hotels and restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the professionals who took us white water rafting, rappelling, and cascade jumping were all extremely well-trained. An unforgettable trip, thanks to Xpediciones!

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

467521069.name: Professional and timely 5 Stars!
467521069.author: a TripAdvisor user
467521069.reviewBody: A great, knowledgable team! Would recommend them to anyone looks to explore everything SLP has to offer. Our group of 10 had an amazing trip.

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

467517802.name: SIMPLY, THE BEST!!!
467517802.author: a TripAdvisor user
467517802.reviewBody: I am from Mexico, I have had the opportunity to travel my country and I can honestly say this agency is one of the best I have dealt with! I took along with me 10 young people from the United States and all I can say is that we felt safe, happy, and well taken care of all the time thanks to MS Xpediciones. The service is amazing and the attention is unique. I would recommend this agency 100% when planning to visit the beautiful Huasteca Potosina! They will help you with anything you need.

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

463756258.name: Going back but won\'t use MS Xpediciones
463756258.author: a TripAdvisor user
463756258.reviewBody: Last summer (2016) we used this company and besides the truck breaking down ( ran out of fuel) was the rudeness that the staff had towards us "The Client". I loved the sites and I\'m planning to go back but definitely not using MD Xpediciones. Old and ugly vehicles and lack of knowledge not only in customer service but how to operate and run a service. Will try either other company or by ourselves if possible to rent the equipment.

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

463216004.name: They worry about everything so you don\'t have to!
463216004.author: a TripAdvisor user
463216004.reviewBody: Perfectly planned trip, with a little extra time in case anything came up or so you could enjoy each attraction a little longer.\nEvery guide was super attentive to our needs and we never had to worry about anything other than enjoying each day as planned!

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

450703316.name: Leave the driving to the experts!
450703316.author: a TripAdvisor user
450703316.reviewBody:
We were connected with MS Xpeditions through a neighbor shortly before leaving on an almost spur of the moment trip to the Huasteca in SLP. My husband had been in contact with Martha by phone and had only mentioned we'd be in the area for two nights. 
Martha arranged 3 tours for us: an afternoon canoe trip to the cascada de Tamul and the next day, a visit to Las Pozas in the morning and late afternoon/early evening at the Sótano de las Huahuas. Both days included lunch at local restaurants. All three destinations were memorable. 
The best part of all the tours was having capable drivers to shepherd us around the sites and navigate the twisted and narrow mountain roads. No worries about driving left us able to enjoy the routes as well as the destinations. 
We would use MS Xpeditions again.

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

437784471.name: Fantastic experiences with the crew at MS Xpediciones!
437784471.author: a TripAdvisor user
437784471.reviewBody:
We had the pleasure of meeting Martha from MS Xpedicions upon arrival in Ciudad Valles from Xilitla, who we found extremely warm, friendly and enthusiastic about showing us her surrounding areas in the Huastecas, a place she has a lot of knowledge about and a passion for! We had 2 fabulous days with her, she showed us some amazing geological sites, natural hot springs, took us to some of her little favourite spots even, including a little panaderia off the main rd towards Xilitla, the cinnamon cakes were so delicious. Martha certainly went out of her way to share  with us her paradise.
On our 2nd day we set off again to see the Ceremonial de Tamaletom with the amazing spinning voladores, also spent some time in the village chatting to the locals and eating tasty local treats...This is a tour not to be missed!!!
In the afternoon we shared the day with Martin, who drove us to see the cascades El Micos, El Minas Viejas y El Salto, chatting on the way about local lifestyle and affairs and having a laugh here and there. Martin was such a nice guy and a gentleman at that !! 
The beauty of Huasteca is nothing short of stunning and we will be returning very soon and will be doing our tours with MS Xpediciones again!! 
Viva Mexico!!

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

357985233.name: Great fun
357985233.author: a TripAdvisor user
357985233.reviewBody:
Had a great fun going for rafting with the team of MS Xpediciones. They've picked us right on time from our hotel, the way to the begging point was pleasant, we got some time to get arranged for the ride, we got all the equipment and the proper instructions. 
The ride in the river went just right, our guide Martin was amazing and gave us some fun time, guided us professionally through the river, and gave the kids we were with (9,12,13,14) a confident feeling.
We had some stops on our ride to do some cliff jumping and having some healthy snacks (jicama, pineapple and cucumber with chili) and at the end of the ride we were taken to have a nice dinner in one of the locals houses, that included tortillas, rice, chicken, some salads, and a sweet drink. 
At the end we were taken back to our hotel exactly at the time we were told.

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

They where very friendly,respectful and professional. Since we where traveling with children, I liked the flexibility that they had with our group. After the first day,they where on time, and their willingness to assist us was just above our expectations. Great customer service.

address.streetAddress: Privada Escontria 15-B Hotel Mision

296854493.name: A great experience!
296854493.author: a TripAdvisor user
296854493.reviewBody:
I travelled alone to Ciudad Valles and so I was looking for a group of people to travel with and see the local sights. I read the reviews of a couple of companies on TA and went to both operators to find out what the tours included. Although the content of the tours are very similar I was impressed by the attitude of the staff in the office at MS Xpediciones. I speak some Spanish and although this is not essential it does help. One of the women in the office speaks good English and she told me that she is available to accompany non-Spanish speakers on tours if the guide does not speak English.

I booked my first tour to cascada de Tamul, and after this booked two more tours with them to cascadas Minas Viejas on one day and Xilitla on the third day. All of the tours include a stop in the afternoon for a late lunch which include local dishes. For the trips to the waterfalls expect to get wet even if you don't want to have a swim in the river. At the gardens of Edward James there are also a series of pools which you can swim in if there is time. The trips are fairly leisurely but you can expect to do a bit of paddling for the trip in the canoe to Tamul. I forgot to pack my swimming clothes and river shoes but these can be bought at the various waterfalls or the market in Ciudad Valles fairly cheaply.

I kept going back to MS Xpediciones because of the friendliness of the guides and the good service. They were punctual for the pick up from the hotel in the mornings and had a slightly later start than some of the other companies. The make up of the groups is always hit and miss but I was lucky, or maybe it's just Mexican bonhomie, and had a great time talking to the other members of the groups, learning about Mexican culture and other places to visit. The van that they used to drive us around was well-maintained and had A/C. The food was good and there was plenty of it. Plenty of local information was offered whilst driving to and from the different sites. All-in-all a great organisation.

uno de mis mejores viajes fue conocer la huasteca... estuve 3 dias, los cuales estuvieron llenos de emocion ... la verdad terminas cansado pero satisfecho..

673029236.name: Dirty water with limited services
673029236.author: a TripAdvisor user
673029236.reviewBody: We drove down from Tamapsopo falls... should have stayed there another day as the water here at Mico was not nearly as clean. We arrived before several tour buses otherwise it would have been really crowded. The waterfalls were nice to look at but we did not feel comfortable getting in the water... also did not feel like doing the boat tour. There was garbage all around and every where on the road up there. Very limited choices on food... we also did not eat as we didn\'t feel like getting sick later (didn\'t trust the food).

665948313.name: Hidden gem
665948313.author: a TripAdvisor user
665948313.reviewBody: My favorite area of the entire country. Not many tourists know about it, so it\'s not too crowded, but unbeatable in terms of nature. Tons of waterfalls and gorgeous cascades, everything is flourishing and the gardens of Xilitla are unique. Must see.

662133603.name: Amazing
662133603.author: a TripAdvisor user
662133603.reviewBody: La Huasteca Potosina is for those that want to see the real Mexico and it\'s amazing natural beauty. There are several waterfalls and rivers to see in the region all different.To get a better Idea what it\'s like go to youtube  to see more ok this beauty. You need at least 2 weeks to see it all as theses places are spread out throughout the state about 1-3 hours apart and the best way to see them is renting a car.I will be going back to see what I missed and revisiting the same places. Each place is a different experience well worth it.

618160099.name: Must ever go there!
618160099.author: a TripAdvisor user
618160099.reviewBody: Amazing place where you can be in deep contact with nature. I hired a private guide tourist, he is Marcos, his phone number and WhatsApp number is +52 1481 104 5147. He is local and he can show you other local places to eat and to have some fun and adventure. He did a great job!! I travel along, but he can manage groups as well. Tampoan river and the different waterfalls and the cenote are unmissable places.

602958021.name: Family trip
602958021.author: a TripAdvisor user
602958021.reviewBody: Great place to have fun with the kids, from jumping from cliff into rivers to long hikes in the mountains to see wonderful caverns and other nature wonders.

597235793.name: Must visit!
597235793.author: a TripAdvisor user
597235793.reviewBody: This place is just amazing. The long ride there is worth it! For nature lovers it\'s a must see in Mexico and it\'s not that touristic.

583979711.name: Localadventures tour from Mexico City
583979711.author: a TripAdvisor user
583979711.reviewBody: It\'s a week later and I still think about my trip everyday. So amazing! Highly recommend this trip to anyone that loves to explore.\n

547535736.name: Beautiful
547535736.author: a TripAdvisor user
547535736.reviewBody: A must visit place in Mexico. Had the opportunity to visit and it was amazing. Although it was cold in the morning, the temperature went up as the day went by. Beautiful river and there\'s a few places to eat within the area, all of them offer typical Mexican food as well as souvenirs. Very inexpensive and delicious.

527691235.name: A must visit!!! Once in a lifetime experience.
527691235.author: a TripAdvisor user
527691235.reviewBody: Our extended family lives all over the Huasteca Potosina. We have travelled there every year at least 2-3 times.  The are small quaint villages, cultural festivals, plenty of eco-tourism activities, indian ruins, waterfalls, colonial churches amazing foods and a couple of locations listed in the book the 1000 places to visit before you die.  For us the best times to visit is between October and Bebruary because the weather is milder.  Spring and summer are extremely hot.  however, Holy week has a lot of religious activities worth seeing.

516827825.name: One of the best jewels of Mexico
516827825.author: a TripAdvisor user
516827825.reviewBody: This is a natural paradise, full of activities to do and stunning places to see. It\'s perfect for an adventure trip

509857774.name: Excellent place to visit
509857774.author: a TripAdvisor user
509857774.reviewBody: If you like nature water activities, la Huasteca Potosina is the place for you a lot of activities and places to visit

502035145.name: Adventure
502035145.author: a TripAdvisor user
502035145.reviewBody: Recommend this experience 100%. Even if you aren\'t the adventurous type, the great view you will see will make you fall in love with nature. No picture can really show the beauty found here. What makes this trip way better is the company and the tour guys. These guys go above and beyond to make you feel safe and yet enjoy the activities. They go at your pace and help with anything they can to make your experience awesome.

495503881.name: So much beauty so little time
495503881.author: a TripAdvisor user
495503881.reviewBody: The Huasteca is enormous so need a few days to try to cover half of what is available to see and do. Plan in advance and if needed hire a guide. They tend to be expensive but you will be secure. If you feel adventurous all you need a map and the ability to speak speak Spanish. \n\nEach location is an hour or more from Cuidad Valles. Every where you look is beautiful so no one was disappointment.

482108010.name: Rafting in Tampaon river
482108010.author: a TripAdvisor user
482108010.reviewBody: I webt with some friends and we did a rafting tour in the Tampaon river. It was awesome. We had a looooot of fun. We did the famous "ruleta" and we fell hahaha. But that fall makes us laugh and put us a huge smile everytime we remember. It was great. If you like a little of adrenaline, you should do this. Its not extreme but very cool!!! At the end of the tour, we had a huuuuge meal which was extremeley delicious!!! They have go pros cameras so they take pictures of everyone and you can use your own too. Do it!

479232637.name: Rafting
479232637.author: a TripAdvisor user
479232637.reviewBody: we went in a rafting tour and its was perfect, great excercise and extremely beautiful views of the river and mountains. The color of the water is perfect

477127973.name: Absolutely amazing place..
477127973.author: a TripAdvisor user
477127973.reviewBody:
You cannot describe this place, you need to come and experience this place. It's beyond words.. 
1)cascade de tamul - we went to see tamul  first.. we started from SLP at around 5:30.. we reached tamul at 9:30 with one coffee break.. we hired a boat at tanchachin.. as we were traveling in a group of 19 with young and adults.. we hired a whole boat for ourselves.. we started rafting at around 10:45. We reached to tamul waterfall at around 12:30 .. the experience was out of this world.. adventurous and funny too. because whenever you pass by another boat, the riders will throw water on you with the help of paddles and bottles and vice a versa .. after viewing the waterfall, we started paddling back to the base where we started.. it took us around one hour to reach..  had amazing vegetarian food at the base (we are vegetarian, it matters a lot to us) then we started for tamasopa .
2)tamasopa: its on the way back from cascade de tamul to SLP.. in between.
Tamasopa is like a village town, there are 4 spots to see at tamasopa.. we were able to cover two.. puente de dios and poza azul. Puente de dios is a heaven who love to swim.. its waterfall covered with plantation n rocks.. and its 20 m deep..beautiful.. we swimmed, dived and enjoyed nature thoroughly.. 
we completed this two spots in one day, it's manageable if you are good at keeping timings..

475694353.name: Do you want water-Mexico? Then do it!
475694353.author: a TripAdvisor user
475694353.reviewBody: Exciting waterfalls, rivers, lakes and wilderness. All in a breath-taking landscape with no end. This is why Mexico is so great!

474844807.name: Bait and Switch.....
474844807.author: a TripAdvisor user
474844807.reviewBody: Very excited to have been doing this trip today but when we signed up several weeks ago we were told we would be picked up in our hotel in San Luis Potos\u00ed.  Sunday when we called to confirm our pick up time, we were told they no longer pick guests up in San Luis Potos\u00ed......glad we called!  Very poor service!

473489825.name: the greatest
473489825.author: a TripAdvisor user
473489825.reviewBody: how can you summarize la huasteca. it is so extensive. we visited tamasopo and the puente de dios, lots of stairs but so worth it. next time i will bring my swimming suit and jump in! also cascadas los micos, not too many stairs at all, we took a short boat ride to see the falls closer and feel the mist. very beautiful. we visited edward james castle and gardens in xilitla, got a tour guide on the grounds to tell us more about it. went to the cave of the swallows at dusk, the most stairs we have ever done, 585, but again, totally worth the trouble to see the birds in action. we missed seeing many more special spots in the huasteca, two days was not enough at all!

473163493.name: Simply breathtaking waterfalls
473163493.author: a TripAdvisor user
473163493.reviewBody: Truly amazing and breathtaking. I heard of this place time and time again so I needed to visit it. The water is crystal blue and looks like a paradise. There are a lot of stairs that will need to be climbed so be prepared. You could also cliff dive into the waters below.

472731113.reviewBody: The Huasteca Potosina is the most beautiful place on Earth! I have never seen just crystal clear, turquoise water! I felt like I was swimming in a pool everywhere I swam. Jumping off of waterfalls, hiking, rappelling, rafting, there is a little bit of everything here. If you\'re bored, Your\'e doing it wrong!

440761422.author: a TripAdvisor user
440761422.reviewBody: With several options to visit that goes from caves, waterfalls, woods, swallows and many things to do, this is a must see place to all the persons that like nature and look for adventures.

410365670.name: Beautiful waterfalls and great  outdoor activities
410365670.author: a TripAdvisor user
410365670.reviewBody: Here you can see the waterfall called Puente de Dios. A beautiful place. You just have to ask for directions as it is not well signed. There are about 145 steps you have walk down in order to reach the water, so take your time. Once you get down there you will not be disappointed.  You can get in the water though it was a bit crowded when I was there, and did not swim.\nYou can also enjoy the cave of swallows and my favorite, very close to Xilitla, Sir Edward James Castle.

398589438.name: Beautiful site - dirty place
398589438.author: a TripAdvisor user
398589438.reviewBody: This may be one of the most beautiful place attraction to visit . However it is so dirty and people in this region are used to it( I guess) . People are cooking and eating inside the waterfall .\nWaterfalls are amazing but definitely not for tourism .

374074296.name: Great area to visit
374074296.author: a TripAdvisor user
374074296.reviewBody: This area of Mexico is impresive, This area hold amazing crystal Clear Rivers, There is aplace called el "Sotano de las Golondrinas" this is like a huge crater where this birds nest. This area also have a place called la "media Luna" where you can dive up to 24 Feet deep.

366435810.name: Wet \'n\' wild world of exemplary colours
366435810.author: a TripAdvisor user
366435810.reviewBody:
backpackers always ask where they can buy peyote at   Las  Pozas, our guide, tells us.  We laugh at the cliche, after all savvy travellers associate mind-altering substances with surrealism.  It all brings back memories of retro-hippie rites of passage.
WE are at Las Pozas, a 30 ha garden of the eccentric Brit James Edwards, near the Mexican village of Xilitla about 400 clicks from Mexico City. There are 36 surrealist-inspired, Dali-esque concrete sculptures created in an exotic paradise ..... where bizarre arches defy  alignment and mosaic snakes line a path, with a staircase leading nowhere and mossy niches overlook an oversized cement orchid.
 Enveloped by steamy heat and jungle growth, we wander along the garden's labyrinth of trails, some of which end at cascades and natural water pools.  
 It is this water that has put this place on the tourist map. The femme describes the colour of the water as 'green-blue shades of a Pantone colour swatch'. The lush rainforest is gorgeously green, the rivers reflecting a brilliant turquoise with the waterfalls acutely aquamarine.  My hue metaphores may be conventional but the experiences here are not.

365278332.name: Area full of  natural treasures!
365278332.author: a TripAdvisor user
365278332.reviewBody: Whether you are into waterfalls (there are 4), caves, birding, hot sulfer springs and orchids, this area has something to offer. You feel perfectly safe with the great people who live here. By all means visit the Huasteca to truly see Mexico.

359577690.name: One of my best vacation!
359577690.author: a TripAdvisor user
359577690.reviewBody: We took the tours from Ruta Huasteca Expedicions, and spent 3 days visiting some of the most beautiful places I have been to. It has to be one of my best and favorite vacation in Mexico. If you like nature and some adventure sports, this cannot be missed out on.

357296422.name: Tour to hustle a potosina
357296422.author: a TripAdvisor user
357296422.reviewBody: Excellent food beautiful views. Depending where you go all tours are within reach from Valles SLP we went one day to Xilitla an a Sunday. Was beautiful people dancing guarantors. And also went water rafting an the arrives torch the water falls just beautiful

350289791.name: Excellent place to visit nature and raw beauty
350289791.author: a TripAdvisor user
350289791.reviewBody:
The review by "Queen J" earlier was spot on; please refer to her review for all the places to visit. Huasteca is a region on the eastern part of the San Luis Potosi province. We drove east from San Luis Potosi via RioVerde to the Huasteca Potosina region. This is a beautifully natural area, with lots of trees, hills/mountains, natural springs, rivers, waterfalls and hiking/climbing. We drove on well paved roads most of the time, and traffic was very sane; no issues with driving. The places we visited that we recommend are 

- Cascades de Tamul; which is a waterfall that you have to paddle to from a small village called Morena, about 20-30 kms north of Aquisimon. Here, for between 400 (shared) and 600 pesos (alone); the guide will take you in his canoe (4km) paddling to the magnificent water falls. The water of the river is turquoise in color (from limestone and minerals in the water), and there are many natural waterfalls along the way. There are a lot of natural springs along the way, where water gushes out of the ground. Clean, clear and fresh water. 

The waterfalls are worth the view, and you can jump/swim off a large boulder "island" near the foot of the falls. You cannot get close to the falls by river because of the rapids. ON the way back, there is a stop at a large cavern which is a natural swimming hole.. 

- Another good place we visited was the Sotano De las Golondrinas; or the cave of the swallows; and is on the outskirts of Aquisimon town. This is a huge cave 330m deep, and the top of the cave is open and about 50m wide. Very early morning (6:30-8:30AM), the swallows come out of the cave by the hundreds to forage for food for the day, returning in the evening. So you have to get here by 6:30AM, and be patient and quiet (swallows will not come out of they sense noise and hence danger threat). When the swallows come out, the fly our counterclockwise out of the cave slowly and then take off by the hundreds. Quite fascinating. 

You get there by driving very early in the morning (about 20 mins from Aquisimon), pay the 30 peso entrance fees, and hike down 560 steps to the top of the cave. Be sure to take a flashlight with you as it is pitch dark at 6AM. 

- Xilitla is a noce picturesque town built on steep hillsides; similar to swiss towns.

344609755.name: Incredible place to explore and discover yourself!!!
344609755.author: a TripAdvisor user
344609755.reviewBody: This is in the top 5 places I have been in Mexico and is almost endless for exploring and discovering new places. A beautiful region of rivers, waterfalls, trails, cliffs, and mountains. \nThe nice thing is you can do tours any way you feel comfortable, from hiking to 4 track tours, Kayak or canoe, or extreme repelling off cliffs it is up to you.\nYou are only limited by your imagination.

337616351.name: Adventure
337616351.author: a TripAdvisor user
337616351.reviewBody: Places that leave you speechless. You cannot miss waterfalls, adventures in a river and throwing yourself at a mini cliff is the perfect setting for your GoPro perfect pic! Just go enjoy Mexico and taste the food that is incredible.

336250331.name: Beautiful region with adventure!
336250331.author: a TripAdvisor user
336250331.reviewBody:
I'm still not sure to what exactly this attraction entry on TripAdvisor is supposed to refer...as the "Huasteca Potosina" is a large forest/jungle region throughout half the state of San Luís Potosí...  As such, here are my recommendations for touring the region:

The "Huasteca" stretches roughly between the  city of San Luis Potosí (NW), to just north of Ciudad Valles (NE), to below the town of Xilitla (SE), and the arroyos (SW), and everything in between. Most sites lie 1-3 hours away from each other or the nearest town. To travel from one end to another takes roughly 7 hours. For this reason, I'd recommend you plan on spending at least a week in this region, if possible. Everything is worth seeing, and there's so much to see. It's basically a lush area with lots of hiking, waterfalls, and caves. Lots of adventure can be had during the right season (Jan through early June) and for the right price ($40 - $200 US), such as waterfall jumping and repelling, canoeing, kayaking, bathing in hot springs, swimming in clear, blue rivers and caves, touring caverns, ziplining, touring missions, convents,  villages, and archaeological sites, etc... Simple entry into any park or attraction is cheap, roughly 20 to 80 pesos ($1 - $5 U.S.). 
Pre-planned tours can be purchased including food, travel, lodging, and adventure tours for those with limited schedules who prefer a brief introduction to the area without the hassle of arranging anything. Of course, the convenience of these tours means you'll pay prices inflated 3 - 10 times what you'd pay on your own.
 I always strongly recommend arranging everything yourself and using public transportation or a rented car to enjoy the luxury of arriving early to avoid the crowds (priceless), and the freedom of dictating your own schedule once there (equally valuable). That said, public buses run to every town in the area and almost every site. As a single, blonde, female traveler, I had zero problems with safety in the region - not to imply that I don't need to be familiar with the area ahead of time (I study up), wary of my surroundings at all times, as inconspicuous as possible (for a white girl), or speak Spanish (my accent passes). I employ all of those skills when traveling, as should you. That said, I can often access areas that may prove tricky for travelers who do not speak any Spanish or are bogged down by pack mules loaded with touristy "stuff" or a pesky passel of kids. 
Nevertheless, here's a quick overview of the most popular tourist sites:

1. Edward James Surreal Gardens (castle, waterfall, and pools), located 15 min outside of the town of Xilitla.

2. Parrot Cave-  Near Xilitla (5 min drive), past the Pemex station, is a huge cave that is visited at sunset by green parakeets (not to be confused with The Huge Cave, El Sótano, near Aquismón). After a few hundred meters, the road curves left, turn right and park in the small lot. Then walk downhill about 8 minutes to the entrance. 

3. Sótano de Las Golóndrinas - This is a massive cave opening - 62 meters, at its widest points, and 372 meters deep. At dawn and dusk each day, large flocks of golondrinas (swallows) leave and return to their nests in the sótano.  By bus, Aquismón is about 1 hr north of Xilitla and 2 hrs south of Ciudad Valles. From Aquismón, buses are rare heading the 8km up to the cave opening. I found a ride half way, but had to walk uphill a few miles for a couple hours to get there.  Entrance fee and hike down to the site are minimal. Go during high tourist season (Feb to May) to rappel or descend (via spiral staircase) into the cave and walk on the massive floor below. 
 
4. El Nacimiento - "the birth" - one of the main rivers that runs throughout the Huasteca. These rivers are all fresh, cold, bright aqua blue, and perfect for swimming in the hot, humid jungle. This one is located 30 minutes north of Xilitla in a tiny pueblo called Huichihuayán. Follow the signs. 

5. Tambaque River - Tambaque is another nacimiento swimming area located on the Tanute River. It's about an hour north of Xilitla, just past the town of Aquismón. Just before the bridge (over the river), is a stone path that leads to the source, where the water cascades into a series of small pools.

6. Missions - visit any of the first five missions established by Friar Junípero Serra - who later founded the California missions - south of Rio Verde, along the road to Jalpan, and Querétaro. 

7. Waterfalls- various waterfalls can be found near the towns of Rio Verde, Tamasopo, Ciudad Valles, and Xilitla.
- The Tamasopo Falls is a 5 minute bus ride just outside the town. 
-The Puente de Dios cave and falls are a 10 min drive in the other direction outside of town. (Closed to all swimming activity during rainy season mid-June through December)
- The Micos Falls are a 15 min bus ride outside of Ciudad Valles.
- The Temazcal Cascades are a 5 minute walk up the road from the parking lot of the Edward James Surreal Gardens. 
- The Tamul Falls is one of the more isolated waterfalls, but well worth finding.  It's best to access it from the direction of Aquismón. The actual waterfall is only accessible by boat. You can arrange a half day tour in Aquismón, and often at the river itself. It takes about two hours to paddle upstream to the waterfall. 

8. Hot springs - Hotel Taninul, famous for its hot springs, is a popular resort located 25 miles east of Ciudad Valles. 

9. Archaeological Zones - Tamuín:
Tamtok and El Consuelo display remnants of the Huastecan culture between the years 600-900, and are located just after the turn off to the Hotel Taninul, on the right.

10. Caverns and caves - there are a variety of caverns throughout the Huasteca south and west of Ciudad Valles, 2 hrs south of Rio Verde (the Arroyo Seco area), and around Xilitla. 

11. La Media Luna - this "Half Moon Lagoon" is a small lake about 30 minutes outside of Rio Verde (which is two hours east of San Luis Potosí). Though it is small, it is ideal for swimming and scuba diving, due to warm (86°), extraordinarily crystal-clear, azure water that becomes profoundly deep once you venture past its shallow fingers. 

12. Authentic Huastecan towns:
- Apezco - This is a small mountain village to the west of Xilitla with amazing  views, reached via a 1-2 hr hike up a steep, dirt road. 
- Tancanhuitz de Santos (Ciudad Santos) is located South of Cd Valles about 40 min north of Xilitla. Look for a turnoff to the right about 20 minutes after you pass through Huichihuayán.  Typical Huastecan dress, handicrafts, and a church built on top of an ancient Huastecan pyramid can all be seen here. Market day in Santos is Sunday.
- Huehuetlán - This is one of the prettiest towns in the area, located on a hilltop above a long, wide flight of stairs. Many trees, bright flowers, and vines make this town picturesque. Take the first turn to your right after the town of Ciudad Santos, cross the bridge, then turn left.
- Axtla de Terrazas / Aguacatitla -- Axtla is a small town about 5 miles outside of Xilitla. At Axtla, turn right to go down to cross the Río Moctezuma on a small ferry.  A few miles ahead, on a gravel road is Aguacatitla, a main hub of medicinal herbal "potions". 

I didn't mention EVERYTHING by name. There are at least 8 major waterfalls throughout the region, 4 or 5 main rivers, and endless cliffs, caves, and caverns to explore. This is truly an area you could visit yearly and never run out of new things to see and do. 

LODGING:
You can always find lodging without reservations in the rainy season and off-seasons like January, February, and probably early May. Otherwise, I'd recommend reservations a few months ahead even when it means paying more. The cheapest and most plentiful lodging can be found in Ciudad Valles, but honestly, it's a pit of a town and the most humid of the entire area. Hot! Hot! Hot! And not in a good way. 
 I'd recommend Tamosopo as a launching pad near the north and southwest activities, and either Aquismón - or the more expensive Xilitla - to be near the activities in the east. They are all very small, quaint towns, but you can still find adequate 2 and 3 star hotels with beautiful surroundings, adequate accommodations, restaurants (although I wouldn't eat in the hotel restaurants), hot water, and vending machines. 

GETTING TO THE HUASTECA: 
1. Fly into the nearest major airport:
- Fly into Mexico City and drive/bus to Xilitla or San Luis Potosí, roughly 7-8hrs. 
-  Fly into Guadalajara and bus 5-6 hrs to San Luis Potosí.

2. Fly into a smaller, closer, much more expensive airport:
- the following airports are three times the cost and will NOT save time, as all routes to these airports are via another airport (usually Mexico City) and incur long layovers (6-12 hrs):
- San Luis Potosí, Tampico, Querétaro, León/Bahía, or Aguascalientes. 

3. Bus from the US:
- Take an 8 hr bus from several Texas border cities. 

If you need more specific advice on bus transportation once you're within the region, read my July 2015 reviews on Hotel Cosmos near Tamasopo, Hotel d'Carmona in Ciudad Valles, Cascadas Tamasopo, Edward James Surreal Gardens (and las pozas), and Hotel Dolores in Xilitla. 

In short, do not let the traveler warnings deter you from visiting one of the most beautiful areas in Mexico (and there are SO many!) Just plan well and use  common sense. 

Hope that helps. Enjoy the Huasteca!

335528223.name: Hidden Paradise
335528223.author: a TripAdvisor user
335528223.reviewBody: Of all the times I\'ve been to S.L.P. I\'ve always wanted to come here. I finally got to go and it was worth the wait. It was a hidden treasure perfect for adventure nature lovers. The hike, scenery, and sounds of the waterfalls were amazing. This is a beautiful place that you must see!

332052008.name: Amazing experience
332052008.author: a TripAdvisor user
332052008.reviewBody: I came to know Huasteca Postosina totally by chance.  What a chance!!!! One of the most incredible places I have been to. The contact with the nature, the landscape \u2026 everything just looks as if takes from a movie, a painting, a dream! Some many things to see, to sense of being part of it\u2026. The harmonious water sound mixed with the singing of the birds,  just a piece of heaven in Earth.

318735728.name: If you want to visit an amazing place, this is the right one
318735728.author: a TripAdvisor user
318735728.reviewBody: This is an ideal place for adventurous people who enjoy camping, hiking, and living close to the nature.  The vegetation is tropical with numerous underground rivers feeding springs, sinks, world-renowned caves, gorgeous waterfalls and turquoise-hued rivers.\n\nTry regional food which is really unique in the world, zacahuil, bocoles, enchiladas huastecas and cecina.

314674292.name: An unexpected paradise
314674292.author: a TripAdvisor user
314674292.reviewBody: Among the many marvellous places you just don\'t expect to find in Mexico, this is definitely one of the most impressive, as you\'ll find waterfalls, jungle and desert in a few square miles. So, if you like hiking and trekking, plan to spend more than a day here because you\'ll be sorry to leave too soon after realizing what a miracle of nature this place is. The best way to visit it would be to know someone who\'s from that area and can show you around. But if yopu are a foreigner alone and away from home just start walking around and you\'ll be surprised and impressed at every step.

305736826.name: Excellent outdoors experience!
305736826.author: a TripAdvisor user
305736826.reviewBody: Huasteca Potosina is not about one place.  It is about visiting many places, from little towns which bring you in touch with the local ancient customs and traditions, to beautiful natural reserves.  From SLP capital city, we began with Tamasopo falls, where we found nice hotels (specially clean). From there, we headed up to Micos fall, another great place to spend several hours of joy. Next day, we visited "Sotano de las golondrinas" (Cave of the Swallows), Rio Huichiuayan, and Pozas de Xilitla.  For lunch or dinner, "La Curva" seafood restaurant was a great place to taste the "acamayas" (freshwater shrimp).  Finally, we got a "jobito" bottle in Ciudad Valles, delicious jobito liqueur. Huasteca Potosina is a little vacation that could last from a two to five days with full of stuff to do every day.  You may get a tours company or just go on your own, it is very easy.

293810671.name: amazing nature
293810671.author: a TripAdvisor user
293810671.reviewBody: One ofthe most beauty places in mexico for sure a place you should visit, the culture, the delicious food and the beauty of the natural attractives. Rivers and waterfalls is just someplaces that you can found here

284905333.name: Cascadas
284905333.author: a TripAdvisor user
284905333.reviewBody: I believe this is the same area we went to when I visited Mexico in my younger years. We didn\'t ride canoes or anything here. However, just hiking through the woods and seeing all the waterfalls was a cool enough experience on its own. The guide also stopped us at the end in an area where we could all wade in waist deep water. They had the area close to a big waterfall blocked off for safety. It was definitely a good experience and a beautiful place to visit.

269631291.name: Jump in the waterfalls
269631291.author: a TripAdvisor user
269631291.reviewBody: Great experience: jumping in the waterfalls, enjoying the nature surrounding you and..viva la vida!\nRafting is also possible in the nearby area.\nI particularly loved Edward James park, reminded me Gaudy park in Barcelona, but located in the jungles and full of lovely creatures..!

260961620.name: Incredible natural beauty
260961620.author: a TripAdvisor user
260961620.reviewBody: If you like the great outdoors, you cannot miss the Huasteca Potosina. There are many places to camp, swim, canoe, hike, and explore. Visit this area for at least a week to see as much as you can.

259918975.name: Unbelievable!
259918975.author: a TripAdvisor user
259918975.reviewBody: I gotta tell you, this has to be the best kept secret in the world...when you think of San Luis you think of desert, dry climate.  The Huasteca is just the opposite, a beautiful green environment with incredible blue water, falls and lots of activities for the outdoor minded.   You have to go!

250930506.name: La Huasteca Potosina es hermosa
250930506.author: a TripAdvisor user
250930506.reviewBody: I love it! I was born there and had to leave when I was 13 but have returned once or twice every year to re charge my batteries. The jungle, the waterfalls, the wonderful people, I love it all.

247927891.name: You should know!
247927891.author: a TripAdvisor user
247927891.reviewBody: One of the best parts of Mexico, with a lot of attractions and lot of nature\'s treasures. Go at the Cave of Swallows, Cascadas de Tamasopo, Museo Surrealista de Edward James, Puente de Dios, Cascadas de Micos, Cascada de Tamul and more. You will certainly fall in love with this paradise.

247071847.name: recommendation for a tour operator HUASTECA ADVANTURE
247071847.author: a TripAdvisor user
247071847.reviewBody: We went on a river rafting in the HUASTECA , adults and children from the age of 9 , with the company HUASTECA ADVENTURE,they are very professional, maintain safety instructions, know how to work under pressure (we fell off the boat after a very stormy rapid ) , and especially thet have teamwork, it\'s reassuring and pleasant!!\nthe huasteca is full of extream activities and everything just beautiful !!

241497554.name: This is Mexico a lot of Mexicans don\u00b4t know they have
241497554.author: a TripAdvisor user
241497554.reviewBody: Visited SLP for business and liked downtown and places near by. I started looking at places with in four hours of driving and discovered water falls such Tamasopo. Them stopped in my way back in media luna. I took the independence route: Queretaro, Guanajuato, Dolores Hidalgo, Pe\u00f1a de Bernal, Tequisquiapan. I bougth very fine wine at cavas Freixenet. Stopped by the mines of Opalo.This was one of my best trips. I am the kind of person that is alway looking for new places.\nPlan for 10 days..

239844160.name: A natural treasure, so beautiful, don\'t miss it if U like waterfalls and nature
239844160.author: a TripAdvisor user
239844160.reviewBody:
Huasteca Potosina is full of activities, nice people, beautiful waterfalls and river...
You can enjoy it alone or with your family.
You just have to know that nothing is near neather well indicated... 
Go from november to march for a clear water color and be there for at least 3 days.

226269512.name: Full of adventure and wonderful nature
226269512.author: a TripAdvisor user
226269512.reviewBody:
I went with my family including my 14 and 7 year old children.
We bought the three day "adventure" package with "Ruta Huasteca" that included the accommodation, entry to attractions and meals. We chose to stay in the "Aldea" that was a type of ecological village with very basic facilities but full of nature and a crystal clear water river. We had breakfast, dinner and sleep in the "Aldea". 
The company picks you up from the Aldea in their own vans and take you to the different attractions, they feed you at the attractions and bring you back to the accommodation. They are very well equipped and have very good knowledge of every place they take you to. 
On the first day we went to jump the waterfalls, swim and climb in Micos canyon. It was exciting and full of adventure and exercise.
On the second day we did rafting on Tampaon river. Instructors were very good, helpful and looked after all my group very well. We had great fun and enjoyed every moment. We will come back to do more rafting!
On the third day we went to Minas Viejas to do abseiling. We were properly instructed on what to do and they equipped us very well and strapped us in the way that two other instructors were making sure we wouldn't fall into the cliff. They made us feel very secure and encourage everyone of us to do the 50 m abseiling. It was a big achievement specially for me who is afraid of the highs. 
Definitely quite worthy and full of wonderful activities and safety. We all loved it and would like to go back to do more of the adventure package.

221221328.name: The most amazing waterfalls
221221328.author: a TripAdvisor user
221221328.reviewBody: I loved all the waterfalls, they were all so beautiful, Cascada del Tamul was my favorite, better than Yosemite, and Yellowstone!!! The color of the water is turquoise blue because of the rocks found underneath it was breathtaking I felt like I was in a little peace of heaven!!! Edward James Castle was fascinating, a must see!!! Great tour guide Deider!!

220132495.name: Amazing sceneries
220132495.author: a TripAdvisor user
220132495.reviewBody: We went to La Media Luna and me and my family had a great time there. ..It\'s a natural swimming pool with crystal clear waters. Will come back next year.

201325749.name: In general
201325749.author: a TripAdvisor user
201325749.reviewBody: everything is excellent, awesome. \nThe staff are incredibly attentive and polite, the best attractions I\'ve been ever, well the best experience of my life. \nI recommend it to all

196641068.name: A beautiful area for adventure tourists.
196641068.author: a TripAdvisor user
196641068.reviewBody: We loved the scenery....the crystal rivers and waterfalls. The caves were amazing but be careful, they can be slippery. The countryside was varied and very attractive.

193797097.name: Puente Del Dios in San Luis Potosi is a MUST!
193797097.author: a TripAdvisor user
193797097.reviewBody:
Puente Del Dios is a the watercourse that can be accessed via the city of Tamasopo in the state of San Luis Potosi in Mexico that has a natural beauty I haven't seen a comparable likeness of anywhere.   This part of Mexico is amazing in that the ecosystem changes radically it seems like every 50 miles or so.   Tamasopo is very much in a jungle and it is a place where water flows out of the ground and mountains as if the earth were just pouring at the seams here.

Honestly there is so much to do in the entire region from Rioverde to Tamasopo to Xilitla and more but just for this review I am focusing on Puente Del Dios but for sure it should be part of a multi-day or even couple of week trip if possible.   We only had 4 days for the region and it was just not enough.

I hope to return in the future and stay and visit more of the waterfalls, caves and other attractions.

Back to Puente Del Dios.   This is a day trip - you can spend a full day there because there are multiple swimming spots along the way.   Check out the attached photos - the water is so blue and clean it's hard to actually get your head around it.  It looks like the color of the Caribbean but it's fresh water.   They have it set up with ropes so that you can swim just below where the water is pouring out of the falls.  You can either jump off a medium sized rock jump to get in or walk around to a place where you can just enter as you would a lake.

The drive from San Luis Potosi is a couple of hours.  It was part of a trip where we drove from Texas to Cancun for us so I can't give the best flight information.  All I can say is that it's beyond worth however it means to get there.

I thought it was pretty interesting that in the most recent Lonely Planet guide it's not even mentioned.  The state of San Luis Potosi gets only a couple of pages.    For us this meant that we were the only tourists in town and we got the whole place to ourselves.   The guide told us that on the weekends it's jam packed with Mexicans - easy to imagine because it's so gorgeous.  Also during the Spring and Summer there can be hundreds of people there in a day.  Go in the Winter (we were there in Feb).  The nights are chilly but the days are great for swimming.  You'll never forget it!

Sort of rambling but a couple of important parts
 - Organize a ride up from Tamasopo - this cost us only $100 pesos (about $8 US) - even if you have a car you don't want to drive to the watercourse.
- The hike is pretty serious - a lot of steps that can be slippery.   No problem for someone in decent shape and well put together and maintained step system but not for a couch potato.
- Your ride might be a guide - ours was but if you take a taxi probably not - Our guide was nice, informative and took as much time as we wanted and was just for a tip (I gave him $100 - he stayed with us for 3 hours).  You could do it without a guide - it's very clearly marked - but the guide worked well for us.

193494467.name: Outstanding
193494467.author: a TripAdvisor user
193494467.reviewBody: This area is full of natural wonders. Everywhere we went, we felt safe. While driving the roads, take your time and take in all the wonderful views. You will see beautiful mountains and jungles. There are waterfalls to visit, a unique castle, the cave of the swallows, and even a wonderful place to scuba dive. This area is for the adventourous and nature lover. Spend a day repelling along a waterfalls or rafting a river. The people are friendly and helpful. And don\'t miss out in trying some of the best coffee grown in Mexico. Can\'t wait to return.

185816554.name: waterfalls, cristal clear water , good food -  all not too touristy
185816554.author: a TripAdvisor user
185816554.reviewBody: the Huasteca Potosina is a very beautifaul place, a lot of rivers, caves , waterfalls.\ndo not expect many big hotels from the famous hotel chains, but yes : do expect, small, comfortable, some-times family run "hotelitos" and "posadas ",

171906929.name: Magical Place
171906929.author: a TripAdvisor user
171906929.reviewBody:
We decided to go to La Huasteca for 3 days, our program was : 1 day in Micos, 1 day in Tamasopo and last day in Xilitla. 

MICOS 

To go to Micos : From Cuidad Valles to go to Micos you have to take a bus  in the station 5 de mayo There are some every hour and it will cost you around 12 pesos per person. After 20 min, it leaves you near a mirador, as to go beat the river you have to take a little stair which is a bit before the mirador on the right side of the street. Once you get down you have to pay 10 pesos/person to be there ... 

Things to do : People will propose to you "Saltos de cascadas" which is jumping from one cascade to another (there are about 7). This will cost around 150 pesos/person and is really worth  it ! They show you were to jump, they bring you under cascade... The cascades go from 2 to 9m. Then of course you can just enjoy swimming in the river. 

To eat : For lunch a bit further on the right, there are little "restaurants" where you can enjoy chicken cooked on the BBQ with rice and tortilla for 40 to 80 pesos ! 

To go back : to Cuidad Valles, there are buses every hour around 40/45 just at the top of the stairs. 

TAMASOPO 

To go : from Cuidad Valles you have a bus that goes to Tamasopo, it takes 2:00 hours to get there. 

To sleep : We hadn't booked any hotel and found one called ... for about 390 pesos. 

To eat : We had diner and breakfast in the restaurant just next to the hotel. Prices and food were ok. 

Things to do : we started by going to Puente de dios which is less crowded in the morning. There you can see a big waterfall, swim in caves, jump from high points, or just go a bit farther along the stream (nearly nobody) to find your little spot to picnic and to relax! 
Then we went to Tamasopo cascades, very nice place with lots of place to swim but quite crowded during WE ! You'll also be able to admire the vestiges of a water mill. There are little restaurants to enjoy a lunch near the stream. 

XILITLA 

To go : from Cuidad Valles there are busses that go, they take around 2:00 to get there.

To sleep : there are 2 or 3 hotels in this village, we divided to sleep at hotel del cielo, quite nice, very clean and comfortable. 

To eat : on Saturday night we had diner in Casa Vieja Cafe, we spent an incredible night, food was good, there was a guitarist and singer playing, the place was full and everybody was joyful !  On Sundays there is a bug market so we decided to have chilaquiles on the market, mmh! So good ! 

Things to do : you can not miss the surrealistic garden of Edward James ! It is incredible and there is so much to see ! After your visit you can go and enjoy a swim in the cascades of the gardens, on WE after 11:00 it is completely crowded. Xilitla is completely different from Cuidad and Tamasopo, it is a nice little village with animation and a cute center ! On Sundays it's really nice to walk around and discover local products ! 

To go back to Mexico City : there is a bus that leaves from Xilitla 4 times per day. 

Hope this will help others plan there trip :)

169775363.name: Puente De Dios is Beautiful!!!
169775363.author: a TripAdvisor user
169775363.reviewBody: We traveled to Tamosopo San Luis Potosi last week and visited Puente De Dios. This is such a Beautiful place. The waterfalls and cascades are so awesome and the water is Sooooo crystal clear. We really enjoyed seeing all the beautiful scenery on our way down the many stairs. Although coming back up the stairs can be a challenge if you are not physically fit. This is not a place for someone who cannot walk stairs. It is also very slippery and it is kind of in the jungle. However, if you have a chance to go......By all means....please go. It is a trip you will not forget!!

150987523.name: waterfalls, woods and sugar cane
150987523.author: a TripAdvisor user
150987523.reviewBody: From Ciudad Valles we took a tour with Jorge Castillo, a really nice man who drove us safely in his big car past sugar cane fields, stopping to talk to and photograph a farmer ploughing the fields with an oxen drawn plough.  We made a delightful stop at the cascaditas before moving up river to  the Playita de amor and Paso Ancho area.  We walked up river through woodland with constant views of the river and rapids before arriving at La puente de Dios, a powerful waterfall where my son and I dived in (Jorge provided us with life jackets) and using ropes laid out across the current we could half swim half pull our way across to a smaller waterfall and climb under it, we swam through a cave/rock bridge with clear bluish water where we could see fish before reluctantly climbing out to rejoin my wife who was happy just to watch and enjoy the beauty of the place.  Later with our life jackets we could float back down the river to the start point, where we continued onto the biggest waterfall of all: Tamasopo.  Splendid scenery, exuberant vegetation and places to eat.  My wife and I chose to stroll and enjoy thar area, whilst my 13 year old son along with local kids could swing from a rope hanging from a tree and drop or dive or somesault into the deep pool below the fall....which kept him happy for at least an hour.\nWe paid about 90 euros for the three of us...it was like a private tour as nobody else had booked that day.  In fact we saw little tourism in the area in spite of the natural beauty.\nWe were going to go on another tour (there were many choices and Jorge was willing to customize the tour for us) the next day to another waterfall and to the S\u00f3tano de las Golondrinas (cave of the swallows), but the weather turned bad and we moved south.

This three different Microsystems are located in an luis potosi with less than three hours you can go from a weather of 65 to 95 across the mountains. La Huasteca has so many rivers and the food is incomparable. You must visit cd. Valles the main door to la Huasteca.
