662552914.name: If I could give them 6-7 stars, I would
662552914.author: a TripAdvisor user
662552914.reviewBody:
So much enthusiasm and fun.  Amazingly well-organized tour company.  Not to sound condescending (because I certainly am not) but I have had well over 8 years of various experiences with Mexican run companies (marinas, solar panels, contractors, tours, resorts, painters, etc), and so many are not organized that I never get my hopes up as not to be disappointed.  

This Mexican tour company blew my socks off.  They always responded nearly at once to any of my questions before the tour.  They paid attention to endless details. They were knowledgeable and cheerful.  They were superb with safety (driving slow in the rain, not passing on double lanes, use of seat belts, double checking of life jackets and helmets before entering the water, etc.).  

They paid for tips, entry fees, and some snacks, so you don’t have to carry much cash (only for personal purchases like coffees, drinks, souvenirs).  They have special parking privileges so you don’t have to walk a kilometer to the entrance of crowded areas.  

There is no pressure to buy from the vendors we visited which can be a hassle with some tour companies.  

I even witnessed them helping out two people who did not even belong on the tour.  Giving excellent meaningful pointers, etc.  For minimal cost, they take pictures for you, so your camera stays safe and dry.  In a nutshell, very professional.  I repeatedly saw many of them pick up trash to help keep the sites we visited clean.

I took the full seven-day ecotour and didn’t regret one day even though my first day was spent in torrential rain, Edgar made it sound and feel fun and the day went by very fast.  On the following day, America shared her knowledge about many other interesting places to visit in Mexico once she noticed my interest.  They have a couple of guides who speak English and German, not sure about French.  I am fortunate to speak fluent Spanish, so I didn’t need that service.  

All the guides I encountered (17 of them) were engaged, fun, eager to please, knowledgeable, patient and good-natured.  But the highlight of all seven days was the rafting on the Tampeon River, which is not part of the ecotour package but since there weren't enough people to go on the tour I had arranged, Ruta Huasteca upgraded me to the rafting - A gift from heaven I will always cherish.

We were given thorough safety explanations and drills before heading downriver.  The river’s water was so tepid you could swim in it for kilometers without getting cold.  The trip is 16km long and involves a few class III rapids.  With 10 people in two rafts, we were accompanied by 3 kayakers for scouting, rescue (of people or paddles), safety, and photos.  Even though the guides know the river well, they didn’t take anything for granted and before each rapid, kayakers would explore for possible logs or other unforeseen problems.  

Once the go ahead was given we would follow them in our inflatable rafts, following instructions from our each of our guides.  In the calmer areas, we were given the choice to stay in the rafts or swim…  Idyllic conditions.  

At one point the river goes underground and portage of the rafts and kayaks is necessary.  To re-enter the water, you can jump down about 5 meters into the water or walk down – depending of your level of comfort and competence.

At the end, and after fun competition between the two rafts, we were served an excellent meal outdoors by the river.  

I truly can’t say enough about Ruta Huasteca.  I will use them again to visit other parts of Mexico.  Their pricing is also extremely fair and affordable.  

Thank you for a great adventure in a beautiful and superbly scenic setting.

651565309.author: a TripAdvisor user
651565309.reviewBody:
I went on a trip there a while ago--and have been meaning to review (over a year). I went with a Yoga group, it was over 20 people I believe. 

Everything was amazing, the logistics were planned out very well. And the guides were amazing. 

As an environmentalist, it was an added benefit to stay somewhere sustainable and where the local people cherished the land. When I went rafting, the guys that accompanied us on the trip, made it a point to kayak to the end of the river to pick up any trash that had accumulated. 

We stayed at the Aldea, and the meals always offered a vegetarian option (very good). 

Aside from that, I would recommend 100% as the guides, planning, and activities were awesome--you always feel safe as the staff is always prepared.

For English speaking guides ask for Martin, Octavio, Azul or Chaak. They are really fun to go with! 

The tour itself is really cool as well. You are taken to a small town near Tamul waterfall and have an instruction there, then the rafting starts and there are multiple currents to go through in a beautiful scenery. There is the option to go swimming and do some jumps as well - so make sure to bring a swimsuit and appropriate footwear. After the tour there is even a lunch with the guides.

Thanks to all the staff for an amazing time,

I did the rafting tour from Xilitla and it may have taken an hour and a half to get to the river but it was totally worth it. Just so you know I've done 3 rafting tours in Ecuador, Costa Rica, and Jalcomulco before and I must say doing rafting in Huasteca Potosina is so far incomparable. The scenery is breathtaking. The water is so blue that one has to be reminded that it's natural. For miles along the river there are no houses, only trees, animals, and pure nature. 

The rivers and rapids themselves are fairly easy to navigate. Beginners should have no problem. 

As for the tour agency, they are professional and always make sure we're safe. Shout out to Elena (from Chile) and Big Mike for looking out for us. Highly recommended. I will definitely return one day to do other tours on offer

Despite of their security measures I fell twice off the boot which normally does not do any harm as you have life vest. By my own mistake I just fell very unluckily with still one feet attached in the boat, that is supposed to give you more stability. By this I hurt my knee and could not continue that tour. The guides and the company managed this very professional and friendly. They immediately took me to the hospital, made sure that everything was clarified with the insurance, brought my husband  and me a little snack and accepted without any hassle our cancellation of the next two days. It would not have made sense to stay longer as I could not walk. We got full refund of our money. Although I suffered this not pleasant incident I can fully recommend this company!

488667589.author: a TripAdvisor user
488667589.reviewBody:
Finally I have some time (I broke my leg playing football yesterday and now I have plenty of time) to post a review. 
We did 3 days custom private tour and it was awesome! Totally we were 9 people and everyone was happy with all the activities. Surprisingly one of our guides had Russian name - Ivan (Ivan, everyone says Hi to you and looks forward to meet you again). 
I'm very grateful to Laura, who has answered tons of my emails and organised everything! 
We were met at Tampico airport with a sign in Russian language and after that I understood, that those guys are awesome and they are willing to go extra mile for their customers. In Huasteca we did rafting, rappelling, we were jumping from waterfall cascades and it was scary. Nevertheless Ivan inspired us not to give up and all 9 people jump down form 8-meter high waterfall. Also we visited Cave of swallows and Edward James garden. Accommodation they have found for us, security measures, food, transportation, guides, recommendation of the restaurants in Ciudad Valley, everything was great! I have even "stolen" some Spanish songs which were played in the van (music is also cool while you spend your time with Ruta Huasteca) and listen to them from time to time. One of our friends had a birthday and a nice surprise with huge cake was organised, thank you guys, it was so much fun for us:)))
Keep in touch,
February 2019 we meet again,
Warmest regards from cold Russia,
Alex and party
In Russian: Друзья, если вы собрались в Уастеку, то долго не раздумывайте. Мы отлично провели время, не на что жаловаться. И цена приятная и приключения огонь!

478997524.author: a TripAdvisor user
478997524.reviewBody: I had a great experience with Ruta Huasteca.  I landed in Mexico City and headed straight to Ciudad Valles by bus.  I had reserved my 4 day package about a month in advance.  If you choose this company and go on excursions, you will find that they are much better organized than the other ecotour companies that you\'ll encounter.  For example, in Edward James\' Garden, we did not have to wait in line to get in, unlike the other companies\' guests.\nWe had extra safety equipment, such as helmets, in the rappelling tours.\nOverall, I would definitely recommend.

449056036.name: Ridiculously good - white water rafting
449056036.author: a TripAdvisor user
449056036.reviewBody:
I would highly recommended doing the white water rafting.

Having never done it before, the staff were unbelievably nice and helpful- fulfilling any desires of the group (photos, toilet breaks etc) being really nice - but not in a 'Cancun I want my tip' kind of way, but genuinely having fun with us throughout the day making for a fun, safe and quite simply breathtaking day.

The setting is like something out of the Lord of Rings and will leave you breathless.

My girlfriend (being the little chicken that she is) was nervous about doing it- the safety training and security equipment were of very high standards and the river isn't too rough.

This is this only tour we did and we were thrilled.

The lunch at the end is quality as well, and the complimentary sherry (beer) with the meal made it a 10 - on - 10 experience.

Suncream up and have your brekky, it is a long tour - around 3 hours in the boat can be exhausting.

Gracias a todos por un día inolvidable.

438559593.reviewBody:
The complete staff, guides, drivers, office, chefs, are amazing, helpful, professionals, Yessica from Public Relations is one of the best person I ever met, always helping with all my questions and requests. The guides Celeste and Aguita OMG what energy, Villalobos, Bernardo and Sari give you all the confidence you need to execute the activities, (rapel and Jumping from waterfalls, Mike Miky ( auxilio, socorro) super fun and professional, I never feel nerveous or insecure doing the rafting, thanks Stefania for your instruction for rafting, I had the most wonderful experience. the rivers, the waterfalls, the lakes, the colors of the water, the view , the food, the hotel, everything is amazing, I will be back as soon as possible and i will bring with me all my family and friends.
you guys at ruta Huasteca receive a big hug, all the best for you , see you soon

Armando J Martinez

417030341.name: Super experience and great customer service
417030341.author: a TripAdvisor user
417030341.reviewBody:
We joined a rafting tour last August on the Micos river, which was amazing! The office is well-organized with friendly staff that speaks perfect English. After arriving at the Micos river, we were given our safety equipment and an extensive instruction after which we hopped onto the boats. The rafting itself is challenging, but it never felt unsafe. The staff is skillful and a lot of fun (thanks Sammy!), and the surroundings are amazing.

After arriving back in Mexico-City, I realised my passport was still in their office in Ciudad Valles. Since it was a saturday, it was actually not that easy to send it by mail. Through a lot of effort from the Ruta Huasteca office, the passport did arrive in Mexico City on sunday morning, for which I want to thank them again.

All in all: great experience and I would definitely recommend it.

408808867.name: Awesome experience! Highly recommended
408808867.author: a TripAdvisor user
408808867.reviewBody:
I went with my wife last week, we took 3 tours: Cascades/Rappel, Rafting & ecotourism(Xilitla/ Zotano Huahuas). All of these recommended.
We took an extra day with another agency, only to try something different and to visit a place that Ruta Huasteca doesn't... we regret a lot!... 
I have compared and I can say Ruta Huasteca are defenitly the best. The guides are very professional and friendly. they make the tours unique, reall they are awesome.
We stayed at the "Aldea Huasteca", and it is an awesome experience. Rustic cabins, you are in touch with nature, but still have accommodations. Is like all included, you don't worry about get transport or find good food. I recommend you to stay there.
You can go with friends, couple or by your self.. anyways you will met new people with your same interests, make new friends.
We was thinking to met the Huasteca by ourselves or with another agency to save some money, but we definitely take the best decision.
We can't visit Tamul because the weather, but it still was a great travel.
I strongly recommend visit Huasteca with Ruta Huasteca for people of every country.

403344407.reviewBody: I would highly recommend booking you tour with Ruta. The guides as everyone has mentioned previously are best!! I think they are what makes the company. I have nothing but good things to say about all their guides. I was very disappointed by the customer service department though, both at the main office and the Aldea. If you book with them you might have to contact them several times before getting confirmation. I spoke with other guest and the only complaint they had was same. The expeditions, as they call them, are amazing and fun. Definitely check them out.

The best part of Ruta Huesteca is the Staff crew!!! The guides are so funny, really friendly and they push you to try crazy jumps and enjoy your trip as much as possible! I would recommand to stay at the Aldea Camping own by Ruta Mexico, the place is really beautiful, well equiped (big and warm showers) and the food is good! You can bring your alcool and music and chill around the fire place all night to enjoy the stars.

361290375.name: An amazing journey!!
361290375.author: a TripAdvisor user
361290375.reviewBody: We spent five days on the adventure tour and I can honestly say it was one of the best vacations of my life. Not only were the guides super knowledgeable about the area, they were committed to supporting local communities, making sure you felt safe and comfortable and just in general wanted to make sure that you were having a great time. We really thought that not only were they prepared form a safety standpoint, but their passion about the area and their job really translated to us. There was so much attention to small details (from\nThe fresh flowers and linens at lung in the middle of the forest after rafting to the reference of us all as one family). I know there are a lot of other companies offering tours in the same region, but Ruta Huasteca Expeditions is so much more than just a tour company and they deserve every peso we spent.
